page.title: 17CHRISTMAS
page.content: Each year a{charity group}called the {Coverack Christmas Tree Appeal}sets up a Christmas tree overlooking the harbour. Just prior to Christmas a large tent is erected close to the tree, under which food is prepared and a barbeque set up. Close by a nativity scene is acted out. Bags of sweets and fruit are prepared. These are given free to all children in attendance on the Saturday evening of the{Coverack {Christmas Tree.}People from miles around come to the village to sing carols by the harbour around the tree. A procession of gnomes (the infant children of the village) led by a sleigh carrying Father Christmas starts the proceedings. Food is sold, raffles and collections organised. The money is raised for{local charities; the major part going to{local {children's homes.
